name: St. Ives Harbour Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would totally recommend the St Ives harbour hotel. Very beautiful interiors, a lovely spa to chill out in, comfy rooms with really comfy beds. and the most amazing and relaxing view out to the sea whilst having your breakfast. We also tried out the spa for a full body massage and loved it. Would return anytime!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the nearby Primrose Valley Hotel which doesn't offer a full evening meal service so decided to eat at the St Ives Harbour Hotel. We were not disappointed. We were given a table overlooking the bay and were served by a very friendly and helpful team. Service was excellent and the food top drawer. Not cheap at £45 a head including a bottle of wine, but three very well presented and extremely enjoyable courses from the a la carte menu and we would certainly go back again.
reviews.title: Excellent Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful 4 days in hotel,lovely setting above beach and room could not be better large very clean lovely small balcony overlooking bay,huge bathroom and all very well equiped .On arrival car parked opposite hotel by valet parking and staff delivered car on request when needed in morning .
reviews.title: early Autumn break

reviews.text: Overall staff very accomadating hotel very clean and although not cheap for out of main holiday season well worth cost and for a quiet well located hotel with the whole of St Ives on your doorstep I can thouroughly recomend it.
reviews.title: Peninsula apartment 6

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in dining room of a good standard but some good eating places in harbour area so eat out on occassions well worth the walk .Seafood cafe especially good.Also for stunning railway views take the Train along the coast ,station only 5 minutes from hotel.
reviews.title: Mini break without the kids

reviews.text: We have just come back from a wonderful weekend--two very attractive and comfortable rooms overlooking beautiful Porthminster beach with very good quality linen on comfortable queen size beds. All the staff were welcoming and helpful and the spa was a particular delight. Breakfasts were freshly cooked and delicious--maybe a little too much choice which possibly slowed things down a bit in the kitchen. The hotel is a short walk into town with all the galleries, harbour and beaches (3, all different!) it has to offer.
reviews.title: A real treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for a short break to celibrate her 60th birthday.We where there from Monday 14th to Thursday 17th of October this year and could not be more pleased with our room(109).
reviews.title: What a cracking hotel.
Relax in a stunning location
reviews.text: It had a sea view which looked out over the bay and down on the town and was equal to any we have had anywhere in the world.
The staff where very friendly and helpful and the meals served in the restaurant to die for and the service was very good.
reviews.title: Service Really Lets This Place Down - Some Good Though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was made up each day to a very high standard and was very clean and fresh.Full marks to all.
reviews.title: Wonderful surroundings very friendly and accommodating staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not recommend the restuarant, poor food choice and quality, VERY expensive wine list, VERY expensive bar drinks, overall a real let down, Would not go back again. Cannot enjoy the balcony for peace and quiet, not one nighs good sleep due to the noise from the Terrace Bar.
reviews.title: Over priced, noisy hotel
Relaxing break
reviews.text: We have had a really relaxing break, the room was very clean and very comfortable, and for a standard room amazing views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were cooked fresh to order with lovely views out of the panoramic dining room windows.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay - Cant wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was delightful and we made full use of it.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would certainly recommend the Hotel, and hopefully will be back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Arrived on the train and had a short walk up the hill to the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with great views

reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful and spotlessly clean, all the staff were all very friendly.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel with fantastic views and service

reviews.text: The food in the restaurant / cooked breakfast to order was delicious and made even better by the glorious views over the bay.
reviews.title: Fantastic view and good quality hotel

reviews.text: Reception was helpful giving advice on walking down to the Tate /shops and even providing a map. After checking out the hotel kindly stored our small pull-along case while we explored the town and we collected it just before our train was due to leave.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, excellent service and tranquil spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A stress free break in beautiful St ives and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: DINNER WITH A VIEW

description: The Hotel is directly above Porthminster beach, a position which gives stunning views across the water. Watch as the waves lap against the famous Godrevy Lighthouse in the distance and feel your troubles disappear. Explore the local harbour, as you meander through the cobbled streets, and then return for dinner at the Harbour Restaurant, serving up seasonal and local food, along with stunning sea views. The Harbour Spa will provide the perfect hideaway, as you indulge in a soothing treatment and then unwind by the pool, gazing out to sea from the comfort of a deeply relaxing and luxurious Spa.
